fields.summary: Field can be changed in bulk edit, although not available due to screen scheme

fields.description:
Hi!
This is our setup:
- We have several custom fields translations in 3 languages.
- We have several custom fields settings by type of incident

When we create an issue of one type settings take rightful custom fields and field descriptions do not appear in the language we have in our profile, but appears in the language in which you created the configuration fields at that moment.
If we change the language of the user profile, descriptions of the fields still appear in the same language.
Excuse my English.
Thank you.
Regards, 
Antonio.
fields.summary: I have problems with the translation of custom fields
Ability to select the 'System Dashboard' when setting a wallboard slideshow

fields.description: If we try to add the gadget "filter result" it shows the gadget "assigned to me" in dashboard.
fields.summary: Filter Result gadget shows assigned to me gadget

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA, if you set the *Allow Unassigned Issues* to *"OFF"* in the General Configuration page, issues can still be unassigned via workflow post functions. The built-in JIRA post-function *"Update Issue Field"* can still set an issue to unassigned. 

=== Expected Behavior ===
The workflow post-function should not be allowed to do so,  as per following the General Configuration settings.
fields.summary: Workflow post-function for unassigning an issue should respect "Allow Unassigned Issues" setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34276].
  {panel}

Here is the steps to reproduce the issue:
# Install a new JIRA instance and create new project.
# Set up the mail handler to pick up the local file.
# Add the file test.eml in the folder <JIRA home directory>/import/mail.
# Wait for 1 minute to let the handler to read the file to create a new issue: 
!Screen_Shot_2013-08-13_at_11.03.42_AM.png!
It seems that the attachment file is not picked up by JIRA.

*PS:* The file test.eml can be correctly open via Outlook and it shows that there is an attachment file inside.
fields.summary: Mail handler is not able to pick up the attachment

fields.description: Although the order of the transition is set with the opsbar-sequence property and is used when rendering the transition buttons when opening an issue, the order of the transitions in the action column of the list view is not respecting this order.
fields.summary: Action column in list view not respecting transition order

fields.description:
Gadget placed on Dashboard cannot be configured. Edit item in gadget menu do nothing when clicking on it.

*Steps to reproduce*
1. install plugin https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.jboss.jira.plugin.build-gadgets into jira 6
2. go to Dashboard
3. click Add Gadget 
4. select "Build Status" gadget and add it
5. open gadget menu on gadget top right corner, click "Edit", nothing happens 

*Notes* 
# Gadget uses standard UserPref element in gadget.xml as described in
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Creating+your+Gadget+XML+Specification#CreatingyourGadgetXMLSpecification-UserPrefElement. However, it works in JIRA 5.2
# There is set of javascript error when viewing Dashboard (in both Chrome 28.0.1500.95 and Firefox 23)

fields.description:
Some searches are particularly slow to return results.  Several of these issues are being addressed in JRA-34271, however I've also noticed that the issue navigator reacts to this by falsely claiming that there are no matching issues instead of reporting that the server timed out.

I was testing using a snapshot of SAC, but I have seen this in other datasets before as well.  See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Issue navigator wrongly claims there are no results when the search times out
Performance of comment and change history searches is poor in large instances.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34270].
  {panel}

issue editing The *Back To Issue* button returns to a different place. 

To replicate:

Run a Search to Detail screen
More
Add watchers
Back to Issue

This returns to the single issue screen, not the Detail view where you came from _as one might expect._   The sidebar is gone too.

This may may be a transitional way of encouraging users to use in-page editing rather than a bug, not sure. :)  It seems a bit mixed between old and new issue update styles and doesn't _flow_ well...
fields.summary: "Back to Issue" behaviour from Detail Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34269].
  {panel}

When working with a customer logset, we found that we could not paste a portion of the logs into a comment without JIRA failing to create the comment.

I am providing a sample bit of text to reproduce this. This text has a null character in it which is the root cause of this. Depending on what text editor you open the file with, the issue may or may not reproduce. Sublime Text 2 seems to cut the copy operation off at the null character, so this does not happen. Textmate reproduces it 100% of the time.

Script console:

{code}Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token < batch.js:5
e.extend.parseJSON batch.js:5
$.ajax.error batch.js:1056
o batch.js:5
p.fireWith batch.js:5
w batch.js:7
d batch.js:7{code}

Reproduced this in AOD and SAC
fields.summary: Null character in paste will break comment action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34268].
  {panel}

Given that I was logged in
  and I am not logged in now, due to the session timing out
When I search for a bug by number in the quick search fiedl

Expected:
Then I am prompted to log in and my search is performed and results are returned.

Actual:
I am presented with a page that says: "
Project Does Not Exist
Error
The project or issue you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators."
fields.summary: Issue / project not found message in issue searches for anonymous users should prompt user to login
Add ability to sort x axis for Two Dimensional Filter gadget
Allow JQL to be used within workflow transition Condtions
The "Autocomplete Renderer" damages the size of the field in the Issue Collector screen

fields.description: The icon is not displayed; the tip is still there - see screenshot. Occurs in FF-22,23 and IE-9.
fields.summary: Activity order icon not displayed.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
* Edit the Assigned to me gadget, and make any changes
* Click save at the bottom of the edit screen

*Expected behaviour*
Changes are saved and screen reverts to the updated view 

*Actual buggy behaviour*
When you click the save button nothing appears to happen. Although the changes are actually saved, the user can't observe this until he reloads the gadget.
fields.summary: Assigned to me gadget doesn't reset back to the updated view, after changes are saved

fields.description:
A couple of rendering problems have been observed with the Assigned to me gadget in JIRA 6.0.6, affecting different browsers including I.E., Firefox and Chrome.
* In I.E.8 the layout is quite broken, as show in the screenshot:
!assigned to me IE8.PNG!
* Also, in chrome and firefox, there are times when the list of issues is cropped from the bottom. This behaviour appears to be a bit random and hard to reproduce. For instance in the screenshot below, instead of showing 10 issues as configured, only 3 issues are displayed the rest seems to be clipped off.
!Assigned to me Chrome.PNG!
fields.summary: Rendering problems with the Assigned to me gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34260].
  {panel}

The list of projects in JIRA is very large and its difficult for a user to search a specific project (from View Projects list).

Below features doesn't help -
1. Type project name to Quicksearch at top-right corner. It returns list of latest tickets present in that project. But it is hard to go to project browse page from issue navigator, unless I am already very familiar with JIRA.
2. Referring recent projects under the Projects dropdown in the main menu doesn't help as sometimes user most likely has never or not for a long time had to report to a given project area, so it probably won't be there.

Hence the ability to search list of projects in JIRA has to be improved. May be in "View All Projects page" or in main JIRA page (like quick search).
fields.summary: Improve the ability to search list of projects in JIRA

fields.description:
Hi All,

I see Connection timeout to SMTP server port 25. Ping to SMTP server works fine but JIRA doesn't send mail and works slowly.

In Mail admin page I see:

This page shows you the current JIRA internal event queue, whose events may trigger notification emails.

The queue currently has 1194 items in it.

The mail queue is currently sending.

    Bypass currently sending mail - Push sending of current mail to the background, to let others through. Mail details will be logged for debugging.




Thanks,
Inessa
fields.summary: JIRA stopped sending mails.
Ability to configure the session timeout for OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34256].
  {panel}

# Create a database and add some tables (an old JIRA db will do).
# Start JIRA without a db configured.
# (BUG) On the first database setup screen, connect to the database above. You should get an error about the database not being empty. JIRA still has a couple of connections to the database open after the failure.

I expect failure on the database to clear all connections to the database.
fields.summary: On setup, a failure with a non-empty database leaves connections to the DB open.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34255].
  {panel}

JIRA should run as an Avatar server for all of our products to allow for a "consistent" experience amongst our applications. This is particularly relevant for organisations that use JIRA as a user server.

This includes:
* FishEye/Crucible
* Confluence
* Stash
* Bamboo

Unfortunately at present customers need to use the individual product Gravatar support to work around this problem.
fields.summary: JIRA as an Avatar server for all Atlassian Products

fields.description:
As per the screenshots the Assigned to me Gadget text wraps issue number in IE8, tested with a total of 11 chrs for a total issue key.

Issue key will wrap on IE8, but will not on Chrome. This is not expected behaviour.
See the duplicate issue JRA-34395 - this is new in 6.0.6.
fields.summary: Assigned to me Gadget text wraps issue number in IE8
Share a Dashboard through Email

fields.description:
If you try open a report page but you are not logged in before, Jira shows a error page with an NPE as reason. As an example try to open [1]. There should be a message which gives a hint to login before or something like this.

[1] http://goo.gl/TSZaD4
fields.summary: Not logged in and accessing a report produces an error page with NPE
Display custom fields even when empty with ability to edit inline
Show Project Key in the dropdown when creating an Issue
Fix broken link on documentation
Allow text-field custom fields to be displayed in heatmap gadget

fields.description:
*======== Steps to reproduce =======*
# Connect JIRA to LDAP directory and sync. (*Connector* type)
# Assign some issues in a project to an LDAP user in JIRA.
# Delete the user in LDAP, and sync again in JIRA.
# Going to the *Project Overview* page, the *issues tab*, we can see that those assigned issues in #2 has become *unassigned* due to the deleted LDAP user: [^UnassignedIssue.jpg]
# If you click on the *Unassigned* link, it will bring you to the Issue Navigator to see the list of unassigned issues. But the list is empty: [^Filter.jpg]


*======== Expected Behavior =========*
# The issue navigator should show the unassigned issues. (previously assigned to the deleted LDAP user)

Reindexing does not help.
fields.summary: Deleted LDAP user's assigned issues cannot be searched in Issue Navigator even though it shows in Project Overview
Give example in the instruction on execute the script

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34244].
  {panel}

When going into the configure columns screen and adding the comments column, nothing is ever displayed.

It is understandable that you cannot display all comments in this view, however, the expected behavior I think would be to see the latest comment.

This would actually be extremely valuable for reporting. Management usually expects to know the latest status in reports, and this can be generally extracted from the last comment.

I would recommend to display max 250 characters in the issue navigator + " - by <author full name>", but display the full comment in exported views and in the Confluence integration too.

Thanks,

David
fields.summary: Issue navigator column for comment field never displays anything

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce:

# Install JIRA6.0.4 with installer and installed as Windows Services
# Setting the JVM options or change related memory settings in the service as in command line of this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup#SettingPropertiesandOptionsonStartup-SettingPropertiesforWindowsServicesviaCommandLine].
# Upgrade JIRA on existing path using JIRA 6.0.6 installer
# Run the command line command to access the service settings again:
# The Service settings are reset to the default

h5. Expected Results:
JIRA service should remain the same settings as previous services.

h5. Actual Results:
The settings of the services was reset despite the name of service still the same

h5. Environment Information (In the Environment Field):
* Windows 8
* Bundled JRE
* Chrome
* Test upgrade of JIRA 6.0.4 to 6.0.6

h5. Notes (Optional):
* The windows services seems to be remove during the upgrade process which could be the result of fixing the [JIRA 5.2 service bug earlier|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30518].
* This didn't occurred before JIRA 5.2 as I test a similar upgrade of 5.1.6 to 5.1.8. The services wasn't removed and the settings are still remain the same as before upgrade.
fields.summary: JIRA Windows Service JVM settings reset after upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34241].
  {panel}

As per [JRA-22153|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22153], the results returned might be in the List View. 

*Suggestion*
It would be better if Issue Navigator returns result in distinct columns, such as the screenshot below

!results.png!
fields.summary: Returns the subtasks of parent issues in separate columns

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.0.6, after clicking on the gear icon next to the issues in _Assign To Me_ gadget, it directs the user to a raw XML page, as the screen-shot attached.

h3.Steps to produce:
# Create few issues and assign it to your user account
# Go back to the dashboard, and check the issues in the _Assigned To Me_ gadget
# Click on the gear icon next to any issue.
fields.summary: "Assigned to Me" gadget shows the raw XML after clicking on the gear icon next to any issue in the gadget

fields.description: I am in the issue list view and want to configure the columns displayed so I can sort by a not searchable but sortable custom field. I get a 404.
fields.summary: 404 for /secure/views/user/viewuserissuecolumns.jsp when trying to configure columns in issue list

fields.description: Currently Project Import fails if users are missing instead of just showing this as an warning -- This is a big design flaw, as when using external authentication (crowd or LDAP), it may be impossible to create users or to prevent them from being removed (leavers).
fields.summary: XML Project Import fails due to missing users (external authencation)
The component field is named "Component/s", but should be "Component(s)"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34236].
  {panel}

Hi there,
we have around 250 projects on our Jira-Server and its hard for us to find old and inactive projects to archive them.

For now we have to click on every project and view the activity stream.
It would be nice to have the last activity date on the global project-list (URL/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa) Maybe also the amount of Tickets of that project.


Kind regards
André
fields.summary: Last Activity on gloabl project-list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking on the cog in a gadget it returns an XML page from the rest endpoint rather than rendering the menu (/rest/api/1.0/issues/10018/ActionsAndOperations)

h3. Environment

# Mac OS X 10.8.4.
# PSQL 9.1.
# Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start up a fresh 6.0.6 instance and create an issue, assigned to yourself.
# Click on the cog in the dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

The menu renders as per normal.

h3. Actual Results

The XML is returned instead.

h3. Notes

No known workaround for the issue at this stage. It appears to be fixed in 6.1-m05-1 as it does not occur in [jira.atlassian.com|https://jira.atlassian.com].

This does not occur in the Issue Navigator List.
fields.summary: The cog gadget in dashboards returns XML instead of rendering in the browser
Changing Jira Issue priority via Email
As an Admin, I would like more granularity over the types of changes that trigger the Issue Updated event
Custom issue type and priority icons should be stored under JIRA_HOME/data on JIRA Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34229].
  {panel}

Currently, when seeing *Released Versions* and *Unreleased Versions* in a versions field (e.g.: Affects Version/s) the order is different. For example, if this is configured in the Project versions:
|!projectVersions.png|thumbnail!|

This is how it will be displayed in the *Affects Version/s* field:
|!affectsVersions.png|thumbnail!|

*Proposed Fix:*
We should make both of them order equally so there won't be any confusion. Either by making both sorted ASC or DESC.
fields.summary: Order 'Released Versions' and 'Unreleased Versions' equally
RendererManager for Custom Release Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34227].
  {panel}

Example: 

When closing a JIRA issue, it would be helpful to copy all links that block other issues and make them be related to those issues. 

In other words, create new related to links for only the links that are blocking another issues. 

Presently one can create new links based on List of Lined issue Keys. For example, could we include an additional field that would allow the customer the ability to select which issue types to duplicate from?
fields.summary: Can I create new links from existing links based on specific link types?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34226].
  {panel}

Currently the documentation here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Sub-tasks#ConfiguringSub-tasks-Configuringsub-taskfieldsdisplayedonparentissues

only says that *The jira.table.cols.subtasks property can accept the values indicated in right-hand column of the IssueFieldConstants table on the Constant Field Values page (of JIRA's API documentation).* In reality, only certain fields are supported, not all. 

For example, the *attachment* field (which is shown in the issueFieldConstants table) cannot be added to the configuration.

A customer commented on the documentation with the following fields that are known to work:
versions, components, issuekey, issuetype, status, resolution, assignee, progress, timespent
fields.summary: Update documentation of Subtasks page to include information of what fields can be configured to be viewed in parent issue

fields.description:
When customers have two Issue Permission Schemes that contain the same security level names, (for example by taking a copy of the existing scheme), the security level is changed to "None" even though the default level is something other than "None".

A screencast that illustrated the problem is attached, named: "IssueSecurityBug.mov"

This behaviour can cause unsuspecting users to create unsecured issues, even though the issues should be created with a security level by default, so this bug creates a potential security issue for customers.
fields.summary: Default issue security level is reset when switching projects during issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34224].
  {panel}

Having the ability to set some kind of password policy is great, there are a few more features that would be very helpful though.

* Configurable password expiration, simply a number of days before a password change is required.
** Allow certain accounts to not expire.
* Configurable password history requirements. We can currently configure similarity checks against the previous password, it would be helpful to configure similarity checks against the previous x number of passwords.
fields.summary: Improvements to the Password Policy features

fields.description:
Having had this problem during the upgrade process reported at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26685, I now have this problem during the installation process too.

When an attempt is made to install JIRA for the first time after JIRA has been installed behind an Apache httpd provided security mechanism (in this case client certificates), the initial database setup fails with a NullPointerException.

This is similar to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/103247/nullpointerexception-during-installation.

The problem seems to be that JIRA interprets the faked basic auth as an attempt to log in, there is no configured database at this point, and so JIRA explodes with a NullPointerException.

What JIRA should do instead is properly handle the case, and give an appropriate message telling the admin to temporarily switch off authnz, or to ignore the provided user and allow the installation to continue.
fields.summary: NullPointerException during installation process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34222].
  {panel}

h3. Meta
(i) This issue duplicates AOD-6676, so please close it wherever it isn't appropriate:

* I've been unsure where to file it and in hindsight JRA might have been the better choice, but I'm unable to move it myself and almost a week has passed w/o any feedback whatsoever, so I hope to get some attention to this potentially severe issue here eventually.
* I realize that you are having a hard time getting on top of the issue queues currently, yet I consider security and data integrity issues critical and expect an initial acknowledgement/triage at least - lacking this minimum feedback,  I'm not comfortable recommending JIRA/OnDemand to my clients/teams right now.

----

h3. Original Issue (filed as AOD-6676 at 2013-08-02T00:49Z)
\[...\]

I've received a few watch notification for [AMKT|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT] issues *just closed as _Won't Fix_* by [~jkodumal] ~4 hours ago, e.g. [AMKT-4509|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4509]/[AMKT-4510|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4510]/[AMKT-4602|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4602]/[AMKT-6358|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-6358] - I've visited a few issues for details now and am slightly disturbed by what I've seen:

* (x) they are *still listed with _Status=Open_ and _Resolution=Unresolved_*
* (x) likewise the last updated date seems to reflect the previous activity only
* (!) yet all issue tabs properly reflect John's closing, i.e._Comments_, _History_, _Activity_ and _Transitions Summary_ properly recorded him closing the issues as _Won't Fix_
* (i) sure enough the issues still show up as _Unresolved_ via JQL now, i.e. the current status is handled consistently at least, see e.g. 
{code}
project = "Atlassian Marketplace" and resolution = Unresolved and issuekey = AMKT-4602
{code}
* (x) other than non formerly closed open issues they don't offer the _Return to Triage_ transition anymore, so the workflow system seems to know about the intended current state _Closed_ not offering that transition in fact

How is this possible? Am I missing something or is this a severe data integrity violation?
fields.summary: Fix apparent data integrity violation with closed issues not actually being closed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34221].
  {panel}

I'd like Questions and Answers to be new items in Jira. Linked with assignees and Jira keys. 
This would make more efficient dialogue through Jira, and quicker responses. 

Background: 
Our main goal for using Jira is to get a structured and efficient dialogue, where information becomes available in most convenient location for everyone. Comments can of course bring dialogue into Jira, but people might get lost in the not always structured flow of items here, and the questions are hidden for people not actively reading the issue.

Questions and Answers might improve communication in the following way
- It will indicate a very clear request for a piece of information, that will be met with another defined piece that fills this need. 
- It may indicate that this can and should be handled quickly
- Different questions can be addressed to different people, without having to reassign the entire issue.
- It can be made visible in many different contexts, to get attention. Having five question listed on the dashboard can inspire a quick response for all of them. It's harder to get a response if five issues are added to an already long list of issues with the questions hidden somewhere within a lot of comments. 

Use case: 
In an issue  I need different clarifications to move on. I trigger a question box and write [@user This is my question]. 
After finishing a question I can write another one, or close the box.
The addressed users can be noticed about a new question in many ways, easily being able to give a quick response or route the question to someone else.
A new tab in the issue can give an overview over the questions asked along with responses. 

The minor implementation is only Question and Answer items, which should make a fairly simple implementation but further functionality might be considered, at least when planning the architecture. 
- The responsible for the question could sign off the response with a value. (Something like OK | NotOk | NewQuestion)
- Follow up questions could be put in context
- There might be a description field for more thorough background information for the question itself, to make sure the main question is kept clear and simple.
fields.summary: Q&A functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34220].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When commenting on an issue via email and attaching an eml file in the email itself, the eml file gets attached to the issue but has no extension.

This causes inconvenience when trying to view the attachment in it's original format (email which is to be opened via email client)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an email to a mail handler inbox which has an eml file as an attachment

h3. Expected Results
# Issue gets created
# eml file attached to the issue with proper extension

h3. Actual Results
# Issue gets created
# eml file attached but does not have any extension

h3. Notes
Not able to reproduce in JIRA 7.1.7 in Firefox

h3.Workaround
# Download and save the file without an extension
# Rename the file with the proper extension
# Open it with preferred email client
fields.summary: Emails with attached emails is saved without eml extension
Clone issue from linked JIRA
Exact phrase searches should only match on the non-stemmed content of the target field

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Install JIRA
# Access JIRA using the url http://<servername>:<portnumber>/<context>

h3. Actual Results:

Accessing the URL {{/secure/Dashboard.jspa}} opens the Dashboard page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34215].
  {panel}

While I appreciate the value of the Priority field, we have a few issue types, where that field is not required or desired. We have removed it from our screen configurations for Create, Edit, and View. It is not appearing on the Create and Edit screens, but it still appears on the View screen, which does not logically relate back to what has been configured. 

To resolve this disconnect, either: 
(1) Designate that certain fields cannot be removed on View screens of issue types (short term solution); or
(2) Remove the Priority (and if this applies to other default fields) from the View screen in complliance with the configuration (preferred solution)
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, when I remove the "Priority" field on an issue's View screen, I expect it to not appear on that screen so that my configuration matches the user's experience
Graph hours by component per month
Stop words should not be ignored on exact phrase searches
Stemming should not be done on exact phrase text searches
Drag and drop inline image in JIRA Comments

fields.description:
The english text
"JIRA will be unavailable to all users until the re-index is complete. This is faster, but may still take a while depending on the size of your instance and hardware."

is translated to:
"JIRA steht allen Benutzern zur Verfügung, bis die Neuindizierung abgeschlossen ist. Das geht schneller, dauert aber je nach Größe der Instanz und Hardware eventuell eine Weile."
But the german version means that JIRA is available to all users.
It should be:
"JIRA steht allen Benutzern erst zur Verfügung, wenn die Neuindizierung abgeschlossen ist. Das geht schneller, dauert aber je nach Größe der Instanz und Hardware eventuell eine Weile."
fields.summary: German translation bug on Re-Indexing page

fields.description: If a user navigates to https://jira.qps.nl when not logged in, the user ends up at a login page with url "https://jira.qps.nl/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa" instead of the system dashboard with url "https://jira.qps.nl/secure/Dashboard.jspa". If that last url is typed in directly than Jira correctly shows the system dashboard with log-on on the right.
fields.summary: Jira does not open on System dashboard

Bizarrely, hitting just https://jdog.atlassian.net/issues/ and letting it redirect to the aforementioned URL works just fine.

The JQL for the filter is:
{code}theme = "Product Language Rollout" AND createdDate >= 2013-05-03 ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34184].
  {panel}

Steps:

1. Create/Edit an issue.
2. Attach an image file. E.g. xyz.png
3. In the Description field, write !xyz.png!
4. Click on the preview icon of the Description field.

Expected Result:
Preview must display the image.

Actual Result:
Fails on Edit with the following error:

!edit-fileattached.png!


Fails on Create with the following error:

!create-attachpreview.png!

Once the issue is edited/created, the resultant issue shows the image correctly on the view issue page.
fields.summary: Preview of attached images fails in 'Create/Edit' dialogs.

fields.description:
We have a View Issue screen with multiple custom fields on both the default tab and a second tab.

Even when there are values in the custom fields, some from the second tab are not display on the view issue screen at all. The ones that are displayed are all shown on one page. No tabs are displayed.

We are observing this on a test instance prior to upgrading our production instance running 4.3. In that version the fields are all displayed, but again all on one page. Can't help wondering what the point of tabs is if they are ignored, but that's another story.

In my search prior to raising this I saw JRA-33758 and thought this was the same, but what we are seeing is slightly different in that +some+ fields are displayed, but not all of those that have a value.
fields.summary: Custom fields in tabs not displayed in View Screen

fields.description:
In iOS 7, attempting to scroll through the bug reports fails. When attempting to scroll, nothing happens. The only way to view comments is to tap the comments button, which will then set the focus to the comments box at the bottom. Affects both iPhone and iPad on iOS 7 builds 11A4435d and earlier.

This bug was noticed on Mojang's bug reporter at: https://mojang.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa

 Here is the development console output using Safari and the developer tools on Mac OS X:
Warning Your are trying to create a ToggleBlock with selector '.twixi'.One already exists with this trigger so has been ignored. (batch.js, line 23730)
Warning Your are trying to create a ToggleBlock with selector '.toggle-trigger'.One already exists with this trigger so has been ignored. (batch.js, line 23730)
Warning Your are trying to create a ToggleBlock with selector '.toggle-trigger'.One already exists with this trigger so has been ignored. (batch.js, line 23730)
fields.summary: Bug Reporter fails to scroll on iOS 7

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34175].
  {panel}

I created a new custom field (text<255) and gave it a description. The field is restricted to a certain project. That project has a field configuration.
When I update the new field's description, the description in the field configuration is not updated. 

I would expect that changing a custom field's description in Admin, Issues, Custom Fields would also change the description of the field in field configurations. Sometimes it does do so I think, but not all the time.

I've seen this in multiple versions of JIRA over the past two years.
fields.summary: Need to change a fields's description in two places

fields.description:
was searches (and normal searches if we fix JRADEV-21991) cannot find users that were deleted before upgrading to 6.0.  so for instance if you had a user 'fred' and you deleted this user in 5.2 and he is a reporter in some issues, after upgrade 'reporter was fred' or reporter = fred  will not find any matching issues.

We will only be fixing this for the current issue state, not the issue history; that is "was", "changed by" and similar searches will not work.
fields.summary: Searches cannot find users that were deleted before upgrade
